info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 12:23PM EDT until May 13 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of western Maryland, including the following counties, Allegany and Garrett and eastern West Virginia, including the following county, Mineral.
* WHEN...Until 630 PM EDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1223 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Keyser... Westernport... Piedmont... Elk Garden... Kitzmiller... Barton... Franklin... Luke... Warnocks... New Creek... Sulphur City... Emoryville... Reynolds... Mccoole... Antioch... Hartmansville... Ridgeville... Dogwood Flats... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Allegany, MD; Garrett, MD; Mineral, WV
